p: The ROC virus was first isolated in 1975 from a fatal case of encephalitis in a restricted area of the Atlantic Forest (Ribeira River Valley Sao Paulo) [ 7]. The case was detected during the 1973â€“1980 outbreak which caused an estimated 1,000 cases of encephalitis in more than 20 municipalities. The mortality rate was 10%, and among the survivors, about 200 suffered balance or mobility sequelae [ 7]. It is unclear how the ROC virus spread to this region and why it subsequently disappeared 7 years later, although antibodies have been detected in rural residents of southeastern and northeastern Brazil. [ 22, 23]. Based on the viral isolation and serological data, it is believed that the ROC virus is maintained in a transmission cycle that involves wild birds, including some migratory species, as the reservoirs, and Aedes and Psorophora mosquitoes, as the vectors.
